text: A bulbourethral gland (or Cowper's gland) is one of two small glands found in the reproductive system of human males. They are like Bartholin's glands. == Anatomy == Bulbourethral glands are found near the urethra at the base of the penis, between the two layers of the fascia. The bulbourethral glands are about the size of a pea. They appear to slowly get smaller as a person gets older.Gray's Anatomy, 38th edn, p 1861 They are made of several lobules held together by a fibres. == Uses == During sexual arousal each gland makes a clear liquid known as pre-ejaculate (pre-cum). This fluid helps to lubricate the urethra for sperm to pass through. It also helps clean out any urineA neglected gland: a review of Cowper's gland or dirt.
